name: WhoSetMeUp
description: WhoSetMeUp? is a social application that
overview: WhoSetMeUp? is a social application that lets users anonymously introduce two people who can then communicate with each other using incognito email addresses. As the most effective way to prompt people to take action is via recommendation1and over 20% of all relationships now begin online2, WhoSetMeUp? marries the trustworthiness of a friend’s introduction with the safety of concealed communication so that users can get comfortable with each other before they share their personal information. But unlike social networking sites like Facebook where users have hundreds if not thousands of “friends,” or dating sites with millions of profiles, WhoSetMeUp? requires a personalized introduction which increases the quality of the connection because it comes from an in-common person who clearly makes the case of why a pair should meet. Moreover, since the introduction is anonymous and the communication is private, there is no pressure nor awkwardness for anyone involved. Nobody is held accountable and users don’t have to do anything until they are comfortable. So whether you’re looking for love or friendship, WhoSetMeUp? gives users the ability to test the waters, qualify the other person, and decide for themselves if they want to engage.
